<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

## Description {#details}

This header defines support for implementing classes that have some trailing object (or arrays of objects) appended to them.

The main purpose is to make it obvious where this idiom is being used, and to make the usage more idiomatic and more difficult to get wrong.

The TrailingObject template abstracts away the reinterpret&#95;cast, pointer arithmetic, and size calculations used for the allocation and access of appended arrays of objects, and takes care that they are all allocated at their required alignment. Additionally, it ensures that the base type is final â€“ deriving from a class that expects data appended immediately after it is typically not safe.

Users are expected to derive from this template, and provide numTrailingObjects implementations for each trailing type except the last, e.g. like this sample:


<ProgramListing>

<CodeLine><Highlight kind="keyword">class </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">VarLengthObj : </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">private</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> TrailingObjects&lt;VarLengthObj, int, double&gt; &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">friend</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> TrailingObjects;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> NumInts, NumDoubles;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">size&#95;t</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> numTrailingObjects(OverloadToken&lt;int&gt;)</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword"> const </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">&#123; </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> NumInts; &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal"> &#125;;</Highlight></CodeLine>

</ProgramListing>


You can access the appended arrays via &#39;getTrailingObjects&#39;, and determine the size needed for allocation via &#39;additionalSizeToAlloc&#39; and &#39;totalSizeToAlloc&#39;.

All the methods implemented by this class are intended for use by the implementation of the class, not as part of its interface (thus, private inheritance is suggested).

<Link id="l00092" /><CodeLine lineNumber="92"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// number of a different type. e.g.:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00094" /><CodeLine lineNumber="94" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/trailing-objects-internal/extractsecondtype"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">template</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &lt;</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">typename</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> Ty1, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">typename</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> Ty2&gt; </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">struct </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/trailing-objects-internal/extractsecondtype">ExtractSecondType</a> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00095" /><CodeLine lineNumber="95" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/trailing-objects-internal/extractsecondtype/#a9a887ef9f6009657a6c0a4936159672b"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">typedef</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> Ty2 <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/trailing-objects-internal/extractsecondtype/#a9a887ef9f6009657a6c0a4936159672b">type</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00096" /><CodeLine lineNumber="96"><Highlight kind="normal">&#125;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00097" /><CodeLine lineNumber="97"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00098" /><CodeLine lineNumber="98"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// TrailingObjectsImpl is somewhat complicated, because it is a</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00099" /><CodeLine lineNumber="99"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// recursively inheriting template, in order to handle the template</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00100" /><CodeLine lineNumber="100"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// varargs. Each level of inheritance picks off a single trailing type</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00101" /><CodeLine lineNumber="101"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// then recurses on the rest. The &quot;Align&quot;, &quot;BaseTy&quot;, and</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00102" /><CodeLine lineNumber="102"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// &quot;TopTrailingObj&quot; arguments are passed through unchanged through the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00103" /><CodeLine lineNumber="103"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// recursion. &quot;PrevTy&quot; is, at each level, the type handled by the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00104" /><CodeLine lineNumber="104"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// level right above it.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00105" /><CodeLine lineNumber="105"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00106" /><CodeLine lineNumber="106"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">template</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &lt;</Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">int</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/align">Align</a>, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">typename</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> BaseTy, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">typename</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> TopTrailingObj, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">typename</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> PrevTy,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00107" /><CodeLine lineNumber="107"><Highlight kind="normal">          </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">typename</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">... MoreTys&gt;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00108" /><CodeLine lineNumber="108" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/trailing-objects-internal/trailingobjectsimpl"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">class </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/trailing-objects-internal/trailingobjectsimpl">TrailingObjectsImpl</a> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00109" /><CodeLine lineNumber="109"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The main template definition is never used -- the two</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00110" /><CodeLine lineNumber="110"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// specializations cover all possibilities.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00111" /><CodeLine lineNumber="111"><Highlight kind="normal">&#125;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00112" /><CodeLine lineNumber="112"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00113" /><CodeLine lineNumber="113"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">template</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &lt;</Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">int</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/align">Align</a>, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">typename</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> BaseTy, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">typename</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> TopTrailingObj, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">typename</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> PrevTy,</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00132" /><CodeLine lineNumber="132"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Ensure the inherited getTrailingObjectsImpl is not hidden.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00133" /><CodeLine lineNumber="133"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">using </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">ParentType::getTrailingObjectsImpl;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00134" /><CodeLine lineNumber="134"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00135" /><CodeLine lineNumber="135"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// These two functions are helper functions for</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00136" /><CodeLine lineNumber="136"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// TrailingObjects::getTrailingObjects. They recurse to the left --</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00137" /><CodeLine lineNumber="137"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the result for each type in the list of trailing types depends on</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00138" /><CodeLine lineNumber="138"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the result of calling the function on the type to the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00139" /><CodeLine lineNumber="139"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// left. However, the function for the type to the left is</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00140" /><CodeLine lineNumber="140"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// implemented by a &#42;subclass&#42; of this class, so we invoke it via</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00141" /><CodeLine lineNumber="141"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the TopTrailingObj, which is, via the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00142" /><CodeLine lineNumber="142"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// curiously-recurring-template-pattern, the most-derived type in</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00143" /><CodeLine lineNumber="143"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// this recursion, and thus, contains all the overloads.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00144" /><CodeLine lineNumber="144"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">static</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> NextTy &#42;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00187" /><CodeLine lineNumber="187"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The base case of the TrailingObjectsImpl inheritance recursion,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00305" /><CodeLine lineNumber="305"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Returns the size of the trailing data, if an object were</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00306" /><CodeLine lineNumber="306"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// allocated with the given counts (The counts are in the same order</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00307" /><CodeLine lineNumber="307"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// as the template arguments). This does not include the size of the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00308" /><CodeLine lineNumber="308"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// base object.  The template arguments must be the same as those</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00309" /><CodeLine lineNumber="309"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// used in the class; they are supplied here redundantly only so</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00310" /><CodeLine lineNumber="310"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// that it&#39;s clear what the counts are counting in callers.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00318" /><CodeLine lineNumber="318"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00319" /><CodeLine lineNumber="319"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Returns the total size of an object if it were allocated with the</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00324" /><CodeLine lineNumber="324"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">static</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">constexpr</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> std::enable&#95;if&#95;t&lt;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00326" /><CodeLine lineNumber="326" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/trailingobjects/#a5b733cf2a7d7206c2d2601cc5b024488"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/trailingobjects/#a5b733cf2a7d7206c2d2601cc5b024488">totalSizeToAlloc</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">typename</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/trailing-objects-internal/extractsecondtype">trailing&#95;objects&#95;internal::ExtractSecondType</a>&lt;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00327" /><CodeLine lineNumber="327"><Highlight kind="normal">                   TrailingTys, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">size&#95;t</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">&gt;::type... Counts) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00328" /><CodeLine lineNumber="328"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">sizeof</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">(BaseTy) + ParentType::additionalSizeToAllocImpl(0, Counts...);</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00337" /><CodeLine lineNumber="337"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// A type where its ::with&#95;counts template member has a ::type member</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00338" /><CodeLine lineNumber="338"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// suitable for use as uninitialized storage for an object with the given</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00339" /><CodeLine lineNumber="339"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// trailing object counts. The template arguments are similar to those</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00341" /><CodeLine lineNumber="341"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00342" /><CodeLine lineNumber="342"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Use with FixedSizeStorageOwner, e.g.:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00343" /><CodeLine lineNumber="343"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00346" /><CodeLine lineNumber="346"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// MyObj::FixedSizeStorage&lt;void &#42;&gt;::with&#95;counts&lt;1u&gt;::type myStackObjStorage;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00347" /><CodeLine lineNumber="347"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// MyObj::FixedSizeStorageOwner</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00348" /><CodeLine lineNumber="348"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///     myStackObjOwner(new ((void &#42;)&amp;myStackObjStorage) MyObj);</Highlight></CodeLine>
